channel.title: Buttons That Change the IP Address
channel.description:
I'm looking for a way to add a button to a client that can change the IP address the server connects to. I don't mean like so they can change it to any IP, but like have two buttons that have preset addresses. For example, two buttons where one says "World 1" and the other "World 2"
World 1 sets the ip to "example.no-ip.info" and World 2 sets the IP to "example.no-ip.org"
Client used: Boxingscape 317 (Blurrs or Delta, I can't remember. Does it make a difference?)
Thanks.

item.title: Buttons That Change the IP Address
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“revengr, post:1, topic:342656”]I’m looking for a way to add a button to a client that can change the IP address the server connects to.
I don’t mean like so they can change it to any IP, but like have two buttons that have preset addresses.
For example, two buttons where one says “World 1” and the other “World 2”

World 1 sets the ip to “example.no-ip.info” and World 2 sets the IP to “example.no-ip.org”

Client used:
Boxingscape 317 (Blurrs or Delta, I can’t remember. Does it make a difference?)

Thanks.[/quote]

JButton world1 = new JButton("World 1");
world1.addActionListener(new ActionListener() {
    public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent event) {
        serverString = "example-no-ip.info";
    }
});

Or something along those lines.

Read full topic
item.source: Buttons That Change the IP Address
